item.title: Uttarakhand forest fire: 7 dead, 2269 hectares of green cover destroyed; Rajnath reviews situation
item.description: Rajnath Singh directed central officials to provide all possible assistance to the state government to control the forest fires.

item.title: Kanhaiya's supporters thrash man for showing black flag during his speech in Patna
item.description: JNUSU president Kanhaiya Kumar's speech was interrupted by a youth showing a black flag and raising Bharat Mata Ki Jai slogan.

item.title: India ready to clear USD 6.5 billion of Iran's oil dues
item.description: Refiners like Essar Oil and Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Ltd (MPRL) owe nearly USD 6.5 billion in dues to Iran.

item.title: Top quotes of PM Modi at launch of free LPG scheme for poor
item.description: The Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojna, aims at providing LPG connections to 5 crore women beneficiaries from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families over the next three years.

item.title: SEE PICS: Lovebirds Karan Singh Grover and Bipasha Basu are now married
item.description: Bipasha Basu and Karan Singh Grover are now officially a married couple. The two lovebirds who have been dating for over a year now finally tied the knot on Saturday (April 30).

item.title: IPL 2016: Axar hat-trick leaves Gujarat Lions reeling in chase of 155
item.description: Gujarat Lions take on Kings XI Punjab in match 28 of the Indian Premier League at Saurashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Rajkot.

item.title: 70 per cent want PM Modi to return to power after 5 years, says survey
item.description: Contradicting the recent debate over Modi wave fading away, the survey points out that while 62 per cent are satisfied with the performance of Modi government, 70 per cent want to him to remain PM till 2024.

item.title: Rajan gets death threat from Chhota Shakeel inside Tihar; SMS vows 'the end'
item.description: Delhi Police sources revealed that an SMS was purportedly sent from the cell phone of Chhota Shakeel, a close aide of fugitive mob boss Dawood Ibrahim, to a senior Tihar jail official threatening to eliminate Chhota Rajan.

item.title: Flying from IGI Airport gets cheaper from today
item.description: The airports tariff regulator AERA had in February issued an order directing Delhi International Airport Limited to discontinue DF from May 1.

item.title: AgustaWestland scam: Manohar Parrikar to place documents in Parliament on May 4
item.description: Manohar Parrikar today said he will state all facts along with the detailed chronology about the AgustaWestland chopper deal before Parliament.

item.title: IPL 2016: Miffed Virat Kohli blasts bowlers after RCB's 15-run loss
item.description: Royal Challengers Bangalore suffered their fourth defeat as they went down to Sunrisers Hyderabad by 15 runs.

item.title: Delhi Odd-Even 3.0 only after more buses, assures AAP government
item.description: Air pollution in the Capital reached alarming levels in the winter and the Delhi high court said the city had turned into a "gas chamber".

item.title: Underworld don Dawood Ibrahim has gangrene, legs may be amputated: Reports
item.description: Dawood Ibrahim is said to be undergoing treatment at Karachi's Liaquat National Hospital and Combined Military Hospital.

item.title: India, Pakistan foreign secretaries to meet tomorrow in Delhi, Pathankot probe on agenda
item.description: The efforts to resume the Comprehensive Bilateral Dialogue at the Foreign Secretary-level hit a deadlock after the terrorist attack on the Pathankot airbase on January 2.

item.title: When a litre costs crores: These are the world's costliest liquids
item.description: We may not think twice about buying various liquids - from water to milk to petrol - but have you thought which are the costliest liquids in the world? Some of them are so expensive that you just can't go with the flow.

item.title: Taiwan finds 4,800-year-old fossil of mother cradling baby
item.description: The 48 sets of remains unearthed in graves in the Taichung area are the earliest trace of human activity found in central Taiwan. The most striking discovery among them was the skeleton of a young mother looking down at a child cradled in her arms.

item.title: This family photo has something deadly in it. Can you find it?
item.description: A family outing turned into an ordeal and left the woman hospitalised and their pet dog dead. Guess how.

item.title: 97-year-old appears for MA exam in Bihar
item.description: For an exam spanning three hours, Kumar took 23 answer sheets. In fact, some of his fellow candidates were probably younger than his grandchildren.

item.title: Don't miss: Pradeep Sarkar's 'Others' on India's first transgender police officer
item.description: The 60-year-old director, known for 'Parineeta', 'Mardaani' and hundreds of popular ad films, has now come out with his short, 'Others', premiered during the India Today Conclave 2016 in New Delhi last month. The three-minute short was formally launched online today.

item.title: Now Showing: My Dream, Imtiaz Ali's short film for #IndiaTomorrow
item.description: The film, which was premiered during the India Today Conclave 2016 in New Delhi last month, was released officially today.

item.title: Now Showing: Reach For The Stars, Hansal Mehta's short film for #IndiaTomorrow
item.description: The much acclaimed filmmaker has now come up with a short film which he has made for India Tomorrow, a campaign being run by the India Today Group to highlight issues that must be addressed to create better and more informed citizens.

item.title: Don't miss: India... India, Meghna Gulzar's short film for #IndiaTomorrow
item.description: The five-minute-long movie, part of India Today Group's India Tomorrow campaign, shows the face of India we have grown up with.

item.title: 'Prime Time' with Rohan Sippy: Has hashtag journalism reduced TV news to mere soundbytes?
item.description: In Prime Time, which Rohan Sippy made in association with the India Today Group, the filmmaker takes the viewers behind the screen and inside a newsroom, where complex incidents are reduced to their lowest common denominators.

item.description: The Prime Minister's Office immediately responds to a letter written by two brothers requesting financial help for their ailing father's treatment. Here are few more letters written by children that the PMO has responded to.

item.title: Sonam Kapoor excited to begin shooting for Neerja Bhanot biopic
item.description: Actress Sonam Kapoor has begun shooting for the biopic of Indian flight attendant Neerja Bhanot, who was murdered while saving passengers from terrorists on board the hijacked Pan Am Flight 73 in 1986.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi's two-month vacation made no difference
item.description: Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi returned from a 58-day vacation to New Delhi on Thursday. The 44-year-old leader was widely slammed for his absence as his party, despite its poor strength in Parliament, took on the NDA government on a range of issues. But his absence actually made little difference to his party.

item.title: Kamaal karti ho yaar rajjo: Salman all praise for fitter Sonakshi
item.description: Bollywood actor Salman Khan has inspired many when it comes to attaining that 'fit and fab' body. Following his instructions, actress Sonakshi Sinha too burnt some fat and got into shape before entering filmdom.

item.title: Ek Paheli Leela: 5 things so absurd you can't miss them

item.title: Ek Paheli Leela trounces NH10, Shamitabh in opening-day collection
item.description: Sunny Leone-starrer Ek Paheli Leela did a brisk business of Rs 10 crore in the first two days of its release.

item.title: Army colonel held for raping mentally-challenged woman in Mumbai
item.description: Colonel Vinod Sahni, who noticed that there was nobody at the victim's home as her mother had also gone out somewhere, entered into the house and forced himself upon the woman on the evening of May 1.

item.title: Anushka blamed for Bombay Velvet promotion cancellation
item.description: A spokesperson for the actor said Anushka Sharma had clearly communicated her inability to attend the event a month ago, even then the filmmakers had blamed the actor despite her very professional record in the industry.
